Name: Gamble
Ingredients: 7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill an Old-fashioned glass .
FINE STRAIN into chilled glass filled with crushed ice.
Review: An easy drinking, gin-laced, fruity summery drink.
History: Created in April 2011 by Matt Donnelly at the Bacchus Pub and Kitchen, London. To quote Matt, "The drink is called a 'Gamble' due to the fact I gambled on changing 'The Bramble'."
Nutrition: One serving of Gamble contains 227 calories
